content:
Suppose you have a text file named "library_visits.txt" that contains records of library visits by students. The file has the following format:
Student Name | Date of Visit | Number of Books Borrowed | Duration of Visit (in minutes)
John | 2021-05-01 | 3 | 60
Mary | 2021-05-02 | 2 | 45
David | 2021-05-02 | 1 | 30
The following sentence is extracted from the file, but it contains a grammar mistake:
"The library was visit by hundreds of students."
How can you correct the mistake in the sentence using the correct verb form and make it grammatically correct?

The sentence "The library was visit by hundreds of students." contains a grammatical error in the verb form. The correct past participle form of the verb "visit" should be used. The corrected sentence should be:

"The library was visited by hundreds of students."
